Division of Public Health has opened a public call center atÂ 1-866-408-1899. For now, the call center will be staffed from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Monday through Friday and have a recorded message after-hours.
DPH also will receive public email inquiries and questions atÂ dphcall@delaware.gov.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: As hard as it is to believe the â€œ100thâ€ day of the school year has come and gone! This annual celebration is always special at McIlvaine, in all of our elementary schools and with our seniors! If it seems that this yearâ€™s celebration seems to have come especially early, it has since we currently have had no weather related closings or delays. Now while I understand that our students are waiting in eager anticipation for that phone call that lets them sleep in, let me tell you about the wonderful things that have taken place in the last few months! Through the support of the Harry K Foundation and the Delaware Food Bank of Delaware, Charlton and Allen Frear opened a food pantry for those families in need. We celebrated the Chinese New Year with our students at McIlvaine, Frear and Simpson. By the way itâ€™s the Year of the â€œRat.â€ Although we prefer saying â€œYear of the Mouseâ€! Â Fifer held a career fair and Brown had a cultural festival. The principal of Star Hill braved the elements to read to her students from the roof. While the high school celebrated seniors signing their college letters of intent and put on an outstanding production of â€œCharlotteâ€™s Web.â€ And to think that I didnâ€™t mention our winter sports, band and chorus performances, community/business breakfasts, Veteranâ€™s Day celebrations, Districtwide Black History Month celebration and of course Stokes Elementary schoolâ€™s famous Math and Potatoes Program! Wow â€“ just think of the great things that will happen the rest of the year! I canâ€™t wait â€“ maybe weâ€™ll even have a snow day!

span.a: RIGHT HERE!Â wheresthebus.com

em.strong: Now you can log in and track your childs bus in real time.Â

p.span: 1. Always know where your childâ€™s bus is
2. Refreshes every 15 seconds for the most accurate arrival times
3. Calculates traffic, traffic lights, and road closures
4. Free for all Caesar Rodney families
5. Works on all iPhone and Android devices

p.span: The Caesar Rodney School District is committed to preventing the spread of the flu in our schools and local community.Â The CR School Nurses partnered with Safeway Pharmacist, Kobus, to provide flu clinics for the faculty and staff at each of our schools and at the District Office. Over 300 employees in the Caesar Rodney School District have already been vaccinated against the flu this school year! Look for the CR Flu Fighter Ribbons attached to the name tags of district employees.
Â We encourage you and your family to join us in the fight against the flu by getting your flu shot today!

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.strong: Vaping letter, resources available for families

span.p: TheÂ attached letterÂ provides important information and resources to help families learn more about the risks of youth e-cigarette/vaping use. Find more information about the dangers of vaping here. DDOE and the Department of Health and Social Services and the Department of Services for Children Youth & Their Families are teaming up to take action and protect our youth from the risks of e-cigarettes. Additionally, be on the lookout for Delaware's Online Vape Toolkit - VapeFreeDE.com. This Delaware designed toolkit will offer free information to facilitate education and awareness about this growing epidemic. The VapeFreeDE.com toolkit will include evidence-based curriculums, sample model policies, downloadable fact sheets and a social media messages calendar for educators, families and healthcare providers to help end this epidemic in Delaware.Â

strong.u: The Caesar Rodney School District is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in employment or educational programs, services or activities based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, veteran or marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identification or genetic information in accordance with State and Federal laws. Inquiries about compliance should be made to the Title IX, District 504 and ADA Compliance Officers.Â

p.span: The following have been appointed to serve as the Districtâ€™s compliance coordinators and grievance officers. These coordinators can be contacted at the Paul L. Dunbar Administration Building at 7 Front Street, Wyoming, DE 19934 or at (302) 698-4800.

p.u: TITLE IX: CIVIL RIGHTS ACT OF 1972

br.span: (nondiscrimination on the basis of sex, educational programs)
Â Dr. Tamara Toles Torain, Executive Assistant to the
Â Amanda Mazzola, Supervisor of Human Resources

br.u: TITLE VII: CIVIL RIGHTS ACT OF 1974

br.span: Â Dr. Tamara Toles Torain, Executive Assistant to the Superintendent
Â Dr. Jessilene Corbett, Supervisor of Instruction

br.u: SECTION 504 OF THE REHABILITATION ACT OF 1973

br.span: Â Kevin Thompson, Director of Student Services
Â TBA, Director of Business and Finance
Tara Faircloth, Director of Curriculum and Instruction
Ken Starke, Supervisor of Facilities Management
Tara Faircloth, Director of Curriculum and Instruction

div.p: Meet or exceed the annual ESEA targets in all cells in the school accountability system. Maintain a safe environment in an atmosphere of caring discipline. Provide opportunities that encourage a partnership of families, district staff members, students and the community. Project revenue resources to maintain the strong financial position necessary to support the needs of the district. Coordinate the districtâ€™s resources and create a plan that aims to ensure all students enrolled in the Caesar Rodney School District for three or more consecutive years will perform at or above grade level by the end of the studentâ€™s third year of enrollment.

Recognizing the value of each individual, and building upon our commitment to excellence, the Caesar Rodney School District is dedicated to the mission of preparing students for a successful, productive and purposeful life in a diverse, global community by: â€¢ Providing quality educational opportunities for all students; and â€¢ Promoting caring attitudes through the school community.
AcademicsÂ Â Â Â ArtsÂ Â Â Â AthleticsÂ Â Â Atmosphere
